intro: Lantana × strigodepressa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lantana, is a hybrid shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to orange, yellow, and red, depending on the variety. The leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, giving the plant its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. This species is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
